newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft nears Comcast deal - reports.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft nears Comcast deal - reports.

text.p: Microsoft Corp is nearing a deal to invest $1 billion in cable television operator Comcast Corp, according to published reports.
Neither Comcast nor Microsoft was immediately available to comment on the reports.
The New York Times quoted executives familiar with the talks as saying Microsoft was seeking to acquire a roughly 15 percent stake in Comcast.
Microsoft would thus gain an avenue into the control and distribution of television programming, it said.
The Times said Microsoft appeared immediately interested in using Comcast's distribution pipeline for Microsoft Network, but Microsoft's interests could extend beyond Internet access.
The Wall Street Journal, also quoting people familiar with the talks, said specific terms of the deal were not available and some issues were not yet settled.

The Journal said Microsoft would likely get Comcast stock in exchange for its investment. It was unclear if the Comcast stock would be newly issued stock, common shares or a combination of the two, the newspaper said.
